overview:
JW recently retired from Learn.com after the sale of Learn.com to Taleo (NASDQ: TLEO), a SaaS Talent Management leader. As the first investor and co-founder, JW & founder Jim Riley helped take Learn.com from $50,000 in revenue to just under $30,000,000 in a hyper competitive market place.

JW was responsible for the day-to-day field operations of the company and developing comprehensive sales and marketing programs.

Prior to co-founding Learn.com, JW previously served as a Senior Vice President at Morgan Stanley and Assistant Vice President at Merrill Lynch for 8 years. He spent over 10 years in the food and beverage industry, including owning his own restaurant at 19 years of age. JW also served proudly in the U.S. Army.
